RECORD.TEXT: 5669108 996091 857234 11/26/1999 12:00:00 AM DIS Unsigned DISCHARGE SUMMARY NAME : 11/26/1999 11/27/1999 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Hypoglycemic seizure . ASSOCIATED DIAGNOSES : Insulin dependent diabetes mellitus and mitral stenosis . PRINCIPAL PROCEDURE : Intubation . Echocardiogram . HISTORY AND REASON FOR HOSPITALIZATION : Ms. Pa is a 67 year old woman with a history notable for congestive heart failure , chronic obstructive pulmonary disease , insulin dependent diabetes mellitus , transient ischemic attacks and paroxysmal atrial fibrillation . The primary care physician also reports an increasing new mitral regurgitation murmur over the past several weeks . The patient has a Persantin Thallium stress test at an outside hospital on 11/22/99 which reportedly was negative for ischemia . She has had no chest pain . Early on the morning of admission the patient was found down , diaphoretic and responsive only to sternal rub . Emergency Medical Service was called . She had minimal crackles bilaterally and had an unremarkable electrocardiogram . Her chest x-ray showed only mild failure . PAST MEDICAL HISTORY : Insulin dependent diabetes mellitus complicated by neuropathy , nephropathy and retinopathy status post laser treatment . Paroxysmal atrial fibrillation without anticoagulation given a history of gastrointestinal bleed . Upper gastrointestinal bleed in 1997 in the context of Coumadin for paroxysmal atrial fibrillation . Hypercholesterolemia status post multiple transient ischemic attacks in the past , status post a right hemiparesis which has now resolved on aspirin . Mild chronic dementia . History of supraventricular tachycardia in 06/99 felt secondary to Desipramine toxicity . Magnetic resonance imaging scan at that time notable only for chronic white matter changes . Congestive heart failure . Depression . Hypothyroidism . Endometrial hyperplasia . Fibromyalgia . Left breast mass with negative mammography . Glaucoma . Relafen which is contra-indicated because of ulcers . Ultram . Melphalan . Bactrim . Desipramine which causes supraventricular tachycardia . SOCIAL HISTORY : The patient lives in a nursing home . No alcohol use . No drug use . No tobacco use . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : On admission to the Medical Intensive Care Unit the patient was arousable to voice . Pupils equal , round , reactive to light and accomodation . She was moving all four extremities . Toes were down going bilaterally . Blood pressure 165/90 . Pupils equal , round , reactive to light and accomodation . Extra-ocular movements intact . Neck supple and non-tender without thyromegaly or nodules . 2+ carotid pulses without bruits . Jugular venous pressure 10 cm . Lungs with crackles bilaterally up the lung field . Heart regular rate and rhythm with a 1/6 systolic murmur with question of an opening snap . A diastolic murmur was noted by one listener . Rectal was guaiac positive . Right heel ulcer with eschar . LABORATORY AND RADIOLOGIC DATA : Amylase 473 , lipase 6.8 , white blood cell count 7.4 , hematocrit 32.4 , platelets 222 . Urine analysis showed no urinary tract infection . Electrocardiogram had normal sinus rhythm with no changes compared with prior electrocardiogram . HOSPITAL COURSE : By system . 1. ENDOCRINE : The patient 's seizure was thought to be secondary to hypoglycemia in the setting of decreased oral intake on her standard anti-glycemic medications . 2. NEUROLOGICAL : The patient has a history of transient ischemic attacks in the past . Her seizure was thought secondary to hypoglycemia and she had no further seizure activity in the hospital . She did have some slightly paranoid behavior which her son says is typical . She was continued on her Trazodone , Neurontin and Zyprexa . 3. CARDIOVASCULAR : The patient had an echocardiogram which revealed a normal ejection fraction , no wall motion abnormalities but mitral stenosis with peak gradient of 19 and mean gradient of 9 , dilated right ventricle , dilated right atrium , and right ventricle systolic pressure in the 60s . She was aggressively diuresed and her shortness of breath somewhat improved as did her pedal edema . After discussion with her primary care physician it was decided that she would have further cardiology assessment as an outpatient . 4. PULMONARY : The patient was extubated quickly after her admission and maintained good oxygen saturation . She was aggressively diuresed for her minimal congestive heart failure . 5. GASTROINTESTINAL : The patient had guaiac positive stools and had an elevated amylase without an elevated lipase . These findings suggest some bowel pathology . The patient is known to have had an upper gastrointestinal bleed in 1997 in the context of Coumadin . An outpatient gastrointestinal workup may be indicated . 6. RENAL : The patient maintained her baseline creatinine which reflects chronic renal insufficiency secondary to her diabetes . The patient was treated on Unasyn for concern of cellulitis . However she did have a low grade temperature to 100F and it was thought that given her diabetes and ulcer on her heel she should be covered for possible cellulitis . She will be discharged on a one week course of Augmentin . The patient was discharged to her chronic care facility on 11/27/99 in stable condition . MEDICATIONS ON DISCHARGE : 1. Albuterol nebs 2.5 mg po q4h as needed . 3. Dulcolax 10 mg pr per day as needed . 4. Mevacor 20 mg po twice a day . 6. Prilosec 20 mg po twice a day . 7. Senna syrup 2 teaspoons po twice a day . 9. Verapamil 80 mg po three times a day . 10. Lasix 120 mg po per day . 11. Trazodone 75 mg po qhs . 13. Synthroid 125 ugms po per day . 14. Kay-Ciel slow release 40 mEq po per day . 15. Heparin 5000 units subcutaneously twice a day . 17. Isordil 10 mg po three times a day . 18. Pilocarpine 2% 1 gtt ou three times a day . She should have a diabetic diet without added salt and low cholesterol . CENTESHA SKIFOLM , M.D. xi DD : Thanksgiving TD : 11/27/1999 1:31 P cc : NYJO SKIZUKDALE , M.D. MEDICINE RESIDENT MED NLM LAKO SCARVTWI , M.D. PULMONARY / CRITICAL CARE UNIT BARLDI HEALTH STAT
